_exec_summary.SummaryText:
I.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Action Policy:
Because of the hazardous nature of NH3 and in compliance with Section 112(r) of the Clean Air
Act, we have accidental release prevention programs and emergency response policies. 
Employees are trained in proper standard operating procedures, including filling no more than 85%
levels to insure no over pressurization; proper use of personal protective equipment, including
neoprene gloves, goggles and proper clothing when in the vicinity of NH3.  Our safety policy firmly
states that employees must not handle NH3 without adhering to these rules. There are emergency
shut off and relief valves on all storage tanks, safety pop-off valves on nurse tanks, and nurse tank
filling stations are equipped with breakaway couplers.

II.  Regulated Substance Handled at this Facility:
Percival Farm Service, Inc. is a retailer of anhydrous ammonia.  The NH3 facility is a 30,000
gallon storage facility  with the latest safety equipment located in a rural area to ensure public
safety.

III.  Worst Case Scenario  vs. Alternate Release Scenario:
The worst case scenario that we were required to develop for this Risk Management Plan involved
a total release of product from the largest storage tanks at this facility. No mitigation available in
worst case. The more common release, failure of a transfer hose, is the one we used as an
alternate release scenario.  Transfer hoses are checked annually, and replaced if necessary. 
Mitigation measures for alternate release are emergency shutoffs and breakaway excess flow
valves.

IV:  Employee Training, Equipment Inspection, Maintenance Program, Documentation:
NH3 standard operating procedures are documented and are a part of training procedure.

V:  Five Year Accident History:
We have had no releases during the past five years.

VI:  Emergency Response Program:
We are in contact with our local fire and rescue department and the Local Emergency Response
Commission regarding our operation

s.  Our LEPC has copy of RMP; emergency numbers are
posted at location.  We have a written emergency action plan.  In addition to training of our
employees, we encourage any emergency responders to attend our safety meetings and visit our
plant and to understand our operation.

VII:  Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
We document the safety inspection of all storage and nurse tanks, transfer hoses, valves and
application equipment.  We will continue training for all new and current employees to insure their
safety and the safe operation of our facility. We comply with external agencies safety inspections.
